feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: it ingests tickers, fetches financial data, generates investment memos, and returns buy/hold/sell recommendations with drivers and risks. Implementation evidence (fetching financial pages, code demos, multiple live examples like Oracle and AMD) and the student's reflection on iterative fixes support a PASS.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates concrete, functional AI integration: an end-to-end workflow (data retrieval → LLM generation → bot delivery) using Google Gemini and scraped financials, plus iterative improvements to reduce errors and produce actionable buy/hold/sell recommendations (Oracle, AMD examples). This shows a thorough, value-adding integration rather than a superficial use.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "Hello, my name is John and today I'm going to be demonstrating the capstone project. Uh I'm going to be showcasing my AI powered financial tool that I built."
"it's going to look up um the Yahoo financial pages and some other financial pages uh to get info and information um and the financials of uh that ticker."
"I have it formatted so that it returns the same format every single time where it's going to give me a very direct recommendation. It's going to tell me to buy, hold, or sell."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student states the problem and goal (building an AI-powered financial tool).  
Implement: student describes execution (fetching Yahoo/other financial pages, using Google Gemini, code demos, running tickers).  
Reflect: student iterated to improve outputs (fixed misreads, refined format and usefulness).
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: it ingests tickers, fetches financial data, generates investment memos, and returns buy/hold/sell recommendations with drivers and risks. Implementation evidence (fetching financial pages, code demos, multiple live examples like Oracle and AMD) and the student's reflection on iterative fixes support a PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "it's going to look up um the Yahoo financial pages and some other financial pages uh to get info and information um and the financials of uh that ticker."
"it simply just takes a ticker and explains to anybody why to do the uh investment option it recommends."
"I have it formatted so that it returns the same format every single time where it's going to give me a very direct recommendation. It's going to tell me to buy, hold, or sell."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover — set clear user-focused goal (take a ticker and explain investment recommendation).  
Implement — built a Telegram bot workflow that scrapes financial pages and calls Google Gemini to generate memos.  
Reflect — iterated to fix hallucinations and improve output format and usefulness.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates concrete, functional AI integration: an end-to-end workflow (data retrieval → LLM generation → bot delivery) using Google Gemini and scraped financials, plus iterative improvements to reduce errors and produce actionable buy/hold/sell recommendations (Oracle, AMD examples). This shows a thorough, value-adding integration rather than a superficial use.
